metadata.title: CVE-2020-27349 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Aptdaemon performed policykit checks after interacting with potentiallyuntrusted files with elevated privileges. This affected versions prior to1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu34.1, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3,1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu19.5, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27349` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

aptdaemon - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3
aptdaemon-data - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3
python3-aptdaemon - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3
python3-aptdaemon.gtk3widgets - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3
python3-aptdaemon.test - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: aptdaemon package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3').
